name: Small Intestine T
title: Clinical and Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  High grade dysplasia and severe dysplasia are generally not reportable in cancer registries, but if a registry does collect these, assign Tis.

**Note 2:**  The nonperitonealized perimuscular tissue is, for jejunum and ileum, part of the mesentery and, for duodenum in areas where serosa is lacking, part of the interface with the pancreas.

**Note 3:**  Code depth of invasion in preference to intraluminal spread or lateral extension to adjacent segment(s) of small intestine or cecum.
footnotes: *T1 is not defined in AJCC 7th edition

Note: T1 has subcategories of T1a and T1b. Assign T1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories.
